alert.note: Alert for Clear Creek (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 9:17PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in central Colorado, Clear Creek. In northeast Colorado, Douglas and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 917 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Castle Rock, southwestern Golden, Evergreen, Roxborough Park, Larkspur, South Platte, Sprucewood, Buffalo Creek, Deckers, Pine Grove, Devil`s Head, Conifer, Wellington Lake, Aspen Park, Cheesman Reservoir, Tiny Town, Pine Junction, Perry Park and Westcreek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
